feed.title: Voyager
feed.subtitle:
Welcome to "Voyager," the podcast where the frontiers of technology, cybersecurity, and scientific discovery converge. Each week, we embark on a digital odyssey through the vast and ever-evolving landscape of the internet to bring you the most intriguing and vital stories from the realms of tech and science.
In "Voyager," we delve deep into the latest advancements in technology, from groundbreaking gadgets and innovations to the software shaping our digital world. We unravel the complex and fascinating world of cybersecurity, keeping you informed about the latest threats, defenses, and trends that matter in our increasingly connected lives.
But our journey doesn't stop there. We also traverse the exciting universe of scientific discovery, bringing you cutting-edge news, interviews with thought leaders, and insights into the research that's changing our understanding of the world and beyond.
Whether you're a tech enthusiast, a cybersecurity professional, or just curious about the scientific phenomena shaping our future, "Voyager" is your guide through the complex web of modern innovation. Join us as we explore the most compelling stories at the intersection of technology, cybersecurity, and science – stories that inform, inspire, and ignite the imagination.
Subscribe to "Voyager" and stay ahead of the curve in this fast-paced digital age. New episodes drop every week, filled with expert analysis, engaging discussions, and a passion for the marvels of the internet era. Set sail with us on this journey of discovery and exploration – into the heart of what's next.

entry.title: The Trust Factor: Navigating Gen AI and Student Distrust
entry.summary:
In recent news, there have been several developments in the field of artificial intelligence (AI). Inside Higher Ed discusses the issue of trusting students when it comes to AI, highlighting the challenges and concerns that arise with the use of AI in education. On a global scale, the US has emerged as the leader in AI preparedness, according to a report by Fox News. However, China, Russia, and Iran are lagging behind in key measures. Education Week features a Google executive who sheds light on what AI can and cannot do for teachers, emphasizing the potential benefits and limitations of AI in the classroom. In an interesting development, Claude 3.5, an AI system, has passed the Mirror Test, a test used to determine if animals are self-aware. This achievement showcases the advancements in AI technology. Moving beyond education, NBC has introduced an AI version of a legendary broadcaster for its Olympic coverage, as reported by NDTV. Alibaba Cloud has revealed its datacenter design and homebrew network used for LLM training, demonstrating their commitment to AI advancements. The artificial intelligence chip market is projected to reach USD 202 billion by 2030, with a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 37.5%, as stated in an openPR report. In terms of new tools and projects, SmartAction has launched a comprehensive AI Starter Kit to simplify the adoption of AI for businesses in improving customer experience. Additionally, the Iliff Innovation Lab has introduced AI TRUST, a new review process aimed at helping businesses mitigate ethical and legal issues in AI technology adoption. Lastly, Google has integrated AI insights into Google Analytics, as highlighted by Social Media Today, providing businesses with valuable data and insights.

New Tools, Products, or Projects:
- SmartAction's AI Starter Kit for businesses to adopt AI and enhance customer experience.
- Iliff Innovation Lab's AI TRUST, a review process to assist businesses in addressing ethical and legal concerns in AI technology adoption.
- Google's integration of AI insights into Google Analytics, offering businesses valuable data and insights.
